Sentencas: The triple phase boundary (TPB) length is one of the most important quantities obtainable from three dimensional reconstructions of solid oxide fuel cells that utilize porous composite electrodes.
Titulo: On the accuracy of triple phase boundary lengths calculated from tomographic image data

Sentencas: However, the choice of TPB calculation method and the voxelation of the microstructures can lead to systematic errors in TPB estimates.
Titulo: On the accuracy of triple phase boundary lengths calculated from tomographic image data

Sentencas: Here, two approaches for calculating the TPB density are compared to investigate how different TPB aspects such as curvature, orientation, and phase contact angles affect the results.
Titulo: On the accuracy of triple phase boundary lengths calculated from tomographic image data

Sentencas: The first approach applies a correction factor to the TPB length calculated by simply summing voxel (volume element) edge lengths that are shared between voxels of three different phases.
Titulo: On the accuracy of triple phase boundary lengths calculated from tomographic image data

Sentencas: The second approach applies a smoothening technique to the TPB curves.
Titulo: On the accuracy of triple phase boundary lengths calculated from tomographic image data

Sentencas: The two methods are compared by calculations on different kinds of artificially generated microstructures and on a real SOFC electrode microstructure obtained by focused ion beam tomography.
Titulo: On the accuracy of triple phase boundary lengths calculated from tomographic image data

Sentencas: Results are presented showing how specific aspects of different microstructures affect the TPB length calculation error.
Titulo: On the accuracy of triple phase boundary lengths calculated from tomographic image data
